thread.title: 'We don't want them to freeze to death': Frankfort gearing up to help those who need to get out of upcoming inclement weather | News | state-journal.com
thread.title_full: 'We don't want them to freeze to death': Frankfort gearing up to help those who need to get out of upcoming inclement weather | News | state-journal.com

author: HANNAH BROWN, CHANDA VENO
title: 'We don't want them to freeze to death': Frankfort gearing up to help those who need to get out of upcoming inclement weather | News | state-journal.com
text:
With frigid temperatures moving into the area, local organizations are expanding their services to help those who need to get out of inclement weather. On Tuesday, the expected high is 18 degrees, according to the National Weather Service.
"I have been to some of the encampments myself, and have seen the effects firsthand," explained City Manager Jason Monroe. "Homelessness is a major concern in our city, as it is in many, but to help with this issue we need to find its root cause. The lack of affordable housing and housing, in general, is one of the factors contributing to this issue that we need to tackle."
